description: Dive into "Alanya's Coastal Paradise: Beach Bliss Awaits" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Alanya's Coastal Paradise: Beach Bliss Awaits

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Alanya, Turkey, Damlatas Cave is a renowned natural wonder discovered in 1948. The cave's unique air composition, with high levels of carbon dioxide and 95% humidity, has made it a popular destination for asthma patients seeking relief. Visitors can combine a trip to the cave with nearby attractions such as Kleopatra Beach, the Cable Car, and Kalesi Fortress for a full day of exploration.

sources.snippet: Located near Kleopatra Beach, Damlata≈ü Cave is a natural wonder that attracts many visitors. The cave, discovered in 1948, is famous for its stunning stalactites and stalagmites, which are believed to be over 15,000 years old. The high humidity and constant temperature inside the cave make it a unique microclimate that is said to have therapeutic properties.
sources.siteName: Tourism Turkey: Top Travel Spots and Tourist Attractions
sources.shortName: Kleopatra Beach, Alanya - Turkey: Best Beaches to Visit 2025

sources.snippet: The Damlatas cave was discovered in 1948, while the port of Alanya was being constructed. This small but magical stalactite cave is situated in front of the Damlatas Beach. The cave is said have asthma curing effects.
sources.shortName: Alanya ‚Äì Travel Guide to Most Popular Beach Resort in Turkey

sources.snippet: Situated in front of the fascinating Damlata≈ü Cave, picturesque Damlata≈ü Beach in Alanya will captivate you with its crystal clear water and natural beauty.
sources.shortName: Guide to Damlata≈ü Beach in Alanya

places.name: Damlata≈ü Cave

reviews.text:
Damlata≈ü Cave is a really fascinating place to visit and a nice little escape from the heat! As soon as you step inside, you feel the cool, fresh air and see the incredible stalactites and stalagmites that have formed over thousands of years, it's truly amazing to look at.
The cave is not very big, but it's well worth seeing, especially if you're interested in nature and geology. The atmosphere inside is calm and quiet, and it's easy to walk around at your own pace and take it all in.
It's also really close to the beach, so it's easy to fit into your day if you're already in the area. The small entrance fee is worth it for such a unique experience. I'd recommend it to anyone visiting Alanya - a little hidden gem that's definitely worth a stop!

Nice activity if you like caves, stalactites and stalagmites. Very reasonably priced at 300TL for two adults (children go free). Only 3 stars as it's a lot smaller than expected. You go in, down some stairs into a recess where there are lots of stalactites and stalagmites.
The cave has ancient healing properties according to legend.
A nice place to escape the heat of the day.

Damlata≈ü Cave is a small and simple place, but it is truly beautiful and worth a visit. The natural formations inside are fascinating, and even though the cave is not very large, it has a unique charm that makes the experience special.

The ticket price is very reasonable, and I really appreciated that they offer a student discount for those studying in T√ºrkiye, which makes it even more affordable. The staff at the entrance were polite, helpful, and welcoming, which made the visit more pleasant.

It doesn't take too long to explore the cave, but it's a nice stop, especially if you are already visiting the nearby Cleopatra Beach. The atmosphere inside is cool and peaceful, making it a great way to escape the heat for a while.

Overall, a simple but beautiful natural attraction with kind workers and fair prices. Definitely recommended if you're in Alanya.

places.generalDescription: Kleopatra Beach, located at the western foot of a promontory in Alanya, offers a long stretch of coarse sand and gentle surf. The beach widens as you head north, providing uninterrupted views of the castle and Taurus Mountains. Along the shore, there are beach clubs with sun loungers and a wide promenade lined with palm trees. Visitors can access the castle via a steep cobblestone road or take the Alanya Teleferik from Kleopatra Beach.

sources.snippet: Kleopatra Beach is renowned as one of Alanya's most iconic sandy shores, offering a stunning backdrop for unforgettable summer sunsets, enhanced by the soothing sound of gentle waves. Located just a short distance from the city center, this beautiful beach provides easy access to a variety of amenities, including beach bars, restaurants with live music, and charming rental apartments with breathtaking sea views.
sources.shortName: The Beaches in Alanya

sources.snippet: This most famous beach is on the coastal road near the city centre.You can tell by the name of this beach, it is no ordinary one. It got its name from royal Egypt herself, Queen Cleopatra. In ancient times, it is said that a Roman general gifted the whole sea to her.Others say that this was her favorite place to swim during the summer, she'd walk on those sandy shores and dive in the deep blue sea.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Alanya

sources.snippet: Kleopatra Beach is nestled in the picturesque city of Alanya and offers a serene and enchanting getaway for families. The beach is known for its fine sand, crystal-clear waters, and accessibility for people with disabilities. Pasha Bay, also in Alanya, is a picturesque beach offering breathtaking views of the Mediterranean Sea and is equipped with a water park and volleyball court for hotel guests.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Alanya

sources.snippet: Close to Alanya city centre is the 2 km long stretch of sand known as Kleopatra Beach. Legend tells that the Egyptian Queen Cleopatra fell in love with the area after swimming in the warm clear waters and sunbathing on the luxurious golden sands. The beach is split into a number of areas and has plenty of sunbeds and umbrellas for hire.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Alanya | SNO
The Best Alanya Beaches Guide

places.name: Kleopatra Beach

reviews.text: The beach itself is amazing,very long and plenty of space for everyone. The sea there is beautiful, lifeguards are everywhere so it seems to be like a safe place to swim. Negative is no free toilet these days Paying 50p for every entry is just stealing money for your basic needs.

This is a beautiful huge beach. It really reminds me of Thailand üòç. The sand is golden and the water was a nice colour in the winter - it must be stunning in the summer. This beach is 100% worth a visit when you're in or around Alanya.

The beach itself is very beautiful and convenient. However, it's very dirty. I don't understand why neither the beach nor the water is cleaned. The water is very polluted by visitors, with microplastics, bandages, and various waste that shouldn't be there visible everywhere. The authorities and visitors show a very careless attitude toward such a beautiful place. It's really a shame.

places.generalDescription: Tosmur Beach in Alanya is a tidy and accommodating sandy coastline, known for its cleanliness and helpful staff. The beach offers clear waters for swimming, with cool streams from the nearby Dimcay river. While the beach may have pebbles and rocks, it provides stunning views both day and night. Visitors can enjoy various attractions and beach bars during the day, making it a beautiful place to relax by the sea.

sources.snippet: Close to many major Alanya resorts and hotels is the fabulous Tosmur Beach. The beach sits at the point where the Dimcay River flows into the Mediterranean Sea mixing warm seawater with cool fresh water and generating some of the clearest and cleanest swimming conditions in Turkey, attracting locals and tourists from a wide area. There are plenty of sun loungers available for rent and also plenty of water-based activities to enjoy, including jet skiing, parasailing and banana boats.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Alanya | SNO

sources.snippet: Tosmur Beach is a beach located about 7 kilometers east of the district center of Alanya. Tosmur Beach, which is one of the most famous beaches of the region, is Decently visited especially on weekends and in summer. The coastline of the beach is quite wide with its large sandy structure.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beach of Alanya - Cleopatra Beach - Damlata≈ü Beach - ƒ∞ncekum Beach - Emirgan Ula≈ü Beach

sources.snippet: Tosmur beach is considered one of the top beaches, it is located in the big bay on the east. It is a place where the nearby Dimcay river and the Mediterranean Sea meet. The sensation of the cold river water mixed with the salty seawater is a refreshing feeling.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Alanya

sources.snippet: Tosmur Beach is a spacious sandy-pebble beach with rocky bays. The sea on the beach is usually undulating, with a large sandy beach and light pebble sea.
sources.shortName: Alanya Beaches - 20 Beach Tips for Young People and Families
The Beaches in Alanya

places.name: Tosmur. Beach.

reviews.text:
Clean beach with amazing views, especially in the night.

At the day a lot of attractions and super cool beach bars
Beach looks not attractive but the water is very clear and nice to swim. Streams of cold water from the river feel nice in hot afternoon. Lots of russian and turkish families.
rocky beach and nice tides.  water great.

places.generalDescription: Damlata≈ü Beach is one of the well-known beaches in Alanya, offering a serene atmosphere and featuring a beautiful cave. Situated in front of the Damlata≈ü cave, this sandy beach provides crystal clear waters and stunning views of the green mountain with the Alanya castle. However, it's important to be cautious when entering the sea due to its rocky and slippery entrance.

sources.snippet: This unique beach, which is actually Cleopatra beach but since it is located directly to the Damlatas caves that can be viewed for only a few lira entry cost, this part of the beach has been named Damlatas Beach. There are plenty of sun loungers, showers and easy access to the sea. In addition to swimming in the sea, you can dive in the bay, snorkel along the coast.
sources.shortName: The Beaches in Alanya

sources.snippet: Damlatas Beach, situated at the western end of the enchanting Alanya peninsula, stands out as one of the region's most renowned coastal getaways. This beach proudly flies the Blue Flag, a symbol of its excellence, and is celebrated for its sandy shores and inviting, shallow, crystal-clear waters, creating an ideal setting for both sunbathing and swimming.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches for Swimming and Relaxation in Alanya

sources.snippet: Damlatas beach is the only wheelchair-friendly beach in the Alanya area. It has sunloungers, showers and easy access to the sea for disabled people. There are also volleyball, basketball and tennis courts available as well as an open-air gym and massive children‚Äôs playground.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Alanya | SNO

sources.snippet: This beach is known as the part in front of the Damlata≈ü Cave and is called "Damlata≈ü Beach". Legend has it that Cleopatra went into the sea on this beach during an expedition in the Mediterranean. Therefore, Damlata≈ü Beach is also known as "Cleopatra Beach".
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beach of Alanya - Cleopatra Beach - Damlata≈ü Beach - ƒ∞ncekum Beach - Emirgan Ula≈ü Beach

sources.snippet: Damlatas beach is all about the friendly ambiance and the sparkling blue water is tempting to dive in. It is also considered to be the best beach in Turkey.It is the only beach that is easy to access for the disabled. How humanitarian is that?
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Alanya

sources.snippet: Damlatas Beach is always crowded with vacationers due to its central location. The combination of fine sand and blue shallow sea creates an eye-catching beauty. The water in the sea is clear, so you can admire the passing fish.
sources.shortName: Alanya Beaches - 20 Beach Tips for Young People and Families
Guide to Damlata≈ü Beach in Alanya

places.name: Damlata≈ü Beach

reviews.text: This is one of the best beaches in the city. It has fine sand, not pebbles. Also, thanks to the mountain, there is very beautiful emerald water. There is a cable car next to the beach. They say that in high season there is an entrance fee, but in December we walked freely.

Damlata≈ü Beach, located in the heart of Alanya on Turkey's stunning Mediterranean coast, is a place where natural beauty and history converge. Known for its crystal-clear turquoise waters and golden sands, the beach offers a serene retreat for sunbathers and swimmers alike. What makes Damlata≈ü truly unique, however, is its proximity to the famous Damlata≈ü Cave, discovered in 1948. The cave, renowned for its healing properties due to its high humidity and constant temperature, adds a mystical allure to the beach's charm. Visitors can explore the cave's stunning stalactites and stalagmites before stepping out to relax on the tranquil shores. Framed by the majestic Taurus Mountains and overlooked by Alanya's historic fortress, Damlata≈ü Beach combines the best of nature, history, and local culture, making it an unforgettable destination for tourists seeking both relaxation and exploration.

No one protects the purity of the water. Yachts and ships dump waste. Dangerous waste floats in the sea, including sewage from human waste on yachts, posing a risk of intestinal infection-do not swallow the water.

places.generalDescription: Welcome to the captivating Oba area, nestled within the scenic coastal paradise of Alanya. Situated along the mesmerizing Turkish Riviera, Oba showcases a harmonious fusion of natural splendor and contemporary elegance. This enchanting district, famed for its sun-drenched shores, verdant landscapes, and abundant cultural heritage, beckons visitors to embark on a voyage of discovery and tranquility.

sources.snippet: Portakal Beach, also known as Oba Beach, is a beautiful 1-kilometer-long stretch of coastline located on the eastern coast of Alanya. It's situated at the confluence of the Oba Stream and the sea, near the mouth of the Dim River. This beach has earned the prestigious Blue Flag status, thanks to its soft sand, gentle waves, and stunning views of the Taurus Mountains adorned with pine forests.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches for Swimming and Relaxation in Alanya

places.name: Oba beach

reviews.text: Quiet, comparable , not bad , in some aspects better than Cleopatra beach. Warm water due to flat rocky bottom.
A nice beach for a walk, nothing special. The water has a lot of rocks in some places so I'm not sure about swimming here in the summer. But overall nice beach
Very nice beach, just need to watch some bad rocks when entering the Sea. Water shoes required!

places.address: Cumhuriyet, Ahmet Toku≈ü Blv. No:112, 07425 Alanya/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Tersane Beach, also known as Sogukkapi Beach, is a serene and peaceful option for those seeking a quieter Alanya holiday experience. It offers pristine waters ideal for sea turtle spotting and swimming alongside historical walls. However, visitors should bring their own amenities like umbrellas and sunbeds as there are no rental facilities available. The beach's small size often leads to crowding, but its calm waters make it popular among tourists.

sources.snippet: Tersane Beach, nestled between the Alanya Shipyard and the iconic Red Tower, bears historical significance as it lies near the Seljuk Sultan Alaaddin Keykubat's creation. This lesser-known treasure offers a unique opportunity to bask in Alanya's rich history while enjoying the sun amidst ancient remnants.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches for Swimming and Relaxation in Alanya

sources.snippet: Tersane Beach is a beach located in a small area in front of the walls between the Shipyard and Kuzyl-Kule. Tersane beach is small in size and covered with pebbles. The beach is not very popular.
sources.shortName: Alanya Beaches - 20 Beach Tips for Young People and Families

sources.snippet: This beach looks very beautiful from afar and there are always no waves. This attracts a lot of people here. However, due to its small size it is often crowded.
sources.shortName: The best beaches of Alanya with photos on the map, Cleopatra

places.name: Tersane Beach

reviews.text: Pretty small beach! Water was no so clean as I expected but still a very nice place to visit!
Beautiful beach and water. Minus a star because there was litter in the water. But overall, gorgeous, depending on the day and weather üòä
Not a fancy, full service beach compare to other great on beach spots. Bring your own towel, umbrella and drinks if needed. But great place to go as the water is calm when others are wavy!

places.address: Tophane, Tersane Sk. No:7, 07400 Alanya/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: When visiting Alanya, there are numerous attractions to explore, including the Cable Car Alanya. This popular tourist spot offers a breathtaking view of the Mediterranean Sea and the entire town from the top of Alanya Castle. The cable car ride is reasonably priced and provides a clean and comfortable experience. Additionally, visitors have the option to purchase VIP tickets for a more exclusive journey. At the top, there are restaurants where one can enjoy a meal while taking in the spectacular views.

sources.snippet: The Alanya Cable Car that goes to Alanya Castle is located on Damlata≈ü Beach. The impressive ride to the Ehmedek area of Alanya Castle has become a very popular tourist attraction.
sources.shortName: Guide to Damlata≈ü Beach in Alanya

places.name: CABLE CAR ALANYA

reviews.text: The Alanya cable car is a must-do experience! For just ‚Ç¨10 (both ways), you get breathtaking views that are worth every cent. As you ascend, the view of Cleopatra Beach is absolutely stunning, and from the top, you get a whole new perspective of Alanya's beauty. The ride is smooth and scenic, offering picture-perfect moments in every direction. Whether you're a nature lover, a photography enthusiast, or just looking for a relaxing activity, this is an experience you shouldn't miss!"

For two return tickets for foreigners are 1000TL but one way is 950TL. ( not sure about the price for the locals) So it's best to get a return ticket to make your money worth. It's quite hot to hike up,  cable car is much more easier. Cable car is stable and you can get a lot of nice views from the top.

If you are renting a car and decided to drive there, best advice to make sure you park at a designated parking area or go earlier before it gets rammed with cars and tour buses.

Return ticket 280TL
Can be a small wait to get a ticket and board.
The ride up takes about 2 minutes and 30 seconds.
Nice view as you travel up or down.
Be aware that there are a lot of steps when you get off at the top and can be difficult but rest areas every 100 metres.

places.generalDescription: Goya Beach Club is a must-visit destination for those seeking a vibrant beachfront experience in Alanya. With breathtaking views and an enticing menu that caters to various palates, this club creates an inviting atmosphere thanks to its attentive staff. While it boasts lively music and an energetic vibe reminiscent of a nightclub, it may not suit everyone looking for tranquility.

sources.snippet: Goya Beach Club is one of the most popular beach clubs in Alanya. There are bars and restaurants for visitors, but prices are very high. If you spend more than 150 liras per person, there is no charge for sun loungers and umbrellas.
sources.shortName: Alanya Beaches - 20 Beach Tips for Young People and Families

sources.snippet: Alanya Goya Beach Club is located close to the starting point of the Antalya ‚Äì Mersin highway. This trendy beach club is one of the most popular venues in Alanya. For transportation, you can choose a private car, taxi or minibuses.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beach of Alanya - Cleopatra Beach - Damlata≈ü Beach - ƒ∞ncekum Beach - Emirgan Ula≈ü Beach

places.name: Goya Beach Club

reviews.text:
Nice place , foam party .
Good atmosphere, music and dj.
Shisha was about 1000lira, but I didn't try it. Because other places from 250-600 lira(hookah)
Prices for cocktail now is higher then in previous review.

Such unfriendly staff, as soon as my husband and i came in those young boys are standing whispering about us and laughing at us.  What pissed me of is when they come to our table and look at us and when we are ordering they secretly laugh. I came to have a good time not to be bullied

My family and I stayed at the hotel a few doors down from GOYA for a week in October 2017. We ended up coming to GOYA every single day... even choosing it over our hotel's beach & pool. The staff is so friendly and helpful, and the bartender Adnan is amazing (makes the best drinks)! The food is also very delicious and the menu has something for everyone.

Infinity pool with a swim-up bar... stunning. It was very hard to leave. Temperature was perfect, pool was clean. There were plenty of sun beds and places to sit/hangout.

DJ was also amazing and played a great variety of music.

I can't wait to come back to Turkey and will definitely be coming back to GOYA!!

places.address: Dinek, Mersin - Antalya Yolu No:11C, 07400 Alanya/Antalya, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Havana Beach Club is a beachfront hotspot that offers a laid-back yet lively atmosphere. By day, it's a tranquil spot to enjoy scenic coastal views and affordable sunbed prices. As the sun sets, the club transforms into a bustling nightlife venue with live music performances and DJ sets. The bar serves up delicious cocktails and food, while the music varies from 90s funk to house and R&B.

sources.snippet: Havana Beach Club has one of the most beautiful beaches in Alanya. The club offers everything you can expect from a luxury holiday. You can swim in the deep blue waters of the Mediterranean or swim in the large pool.
sources.shortName: Alanya Beaches - 20 Beach Tips for Young People and Families

places.name: Havana Beach Club

reviews.text: One of my favorite places. The service is werry good, the food is great and thy have a great pool area.
Good club with nice staff. Was 4 boys that went together no problem getting in! The guy that took care of us was really nice, helped us pick out what we should drink

Fantastic, chilled vibes. Loved the live DJ. Double sun beds, with good shaded areas
Pool was lovely with a great swim up bar. All very calm & relaxing.
Food and drink at reasonable cost & a great selection.
Waiting staff, very attentive.
Booked through our hotel, the Kayha Resort & Spa.
5 stars, all round

places.address: Dinek, Emirgan Blv No:3, 07400 Alanya/Antalya, T√ºrkiye
